title: Samsung Galaxy Ring finally arrives in India
description: Having started taking reservations for it earlier this week, today Samsung has officially launched the Galaxy Ring in India, finally, months after the international unveiling. To celebrate this, it even released its very own official unboxing of the device. The Galaxy Ring costs INR 38,999 in India and comes in Titanium Black, Titanium Silver, and Titanium Gold. You can also get it for INR 1,625 per month with 24 months No Cost EMI across leading bank cards or financing through Samsung Finance+ and Bajaj Finance. If you buy one until October 18, you also get a 25W travel adapter for...
excerpt: You can already order one. Having started taking reservations for it earlier this week, today Samsung has officially launched the Galaxy Ring in India,...
text: Having started taking reservations for it earlier this week, today Samsung has officially launched the Galaxy Ring in India, finally, months after the international unveiling. To celebrate this, it even released its very own official unboxing of the device. The Galaxy Ring costs INR 38,999 in India and comes in Titanium Black, Titanium Silver, and Titanium Gold. You can also get it for INR 1,625 per month with 24 months No Cost EMI across leading bank cards or financing through Samsung Finance+ and Bajaj Finance. If you buy one until October 18, you also get a 25W travel adapter for free. Like everywhere else, if you're unsure which of the nine different sizes to pick, then you can first get a sizing kit from Samsung to figure out what your best fit is. The Galaxy Ring is available from Samsung's online store and will also be listed by Amazon and Flipkart soon. If you're interested in learning more about the Galaxy Ring, don't miss our in-depth review of Samsung's newest wearable.
html:
Having started taking reservations for it earlier this week, today Samsung has officially launched the Galaxy Ring in India, finally, months after the international unveiling. To celebrate this, it even released its very own official unboxing of the device.

The Galaxy Ring costs INR 38,999 in India and comes in Titanium Black, Titanium Silver, and Titanium Gold. You can also get it for INR 1,625 per month with 24 months No Cost EMI across leading bank cards or financing through Samsung Finance+ and Bajaj Finance. If you buy one until October 18, you also get a 25W travel adapter for free.

Like everywhere else, if you're unsure which of the nine different sizes to pick, then you can first get a sizing kit from Samsung to figure out what your best fit is.

The Galaxy Ring is available from Samsung's online store and will also be listed by Amazon and Flipkart soon.

If you're interested in learning more about the Galaxy Ring, don't miss our in-depth review of Samsung's newest wearable.
